ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: So much about modernism and 19th and 20th century history in general. This was such a great class, and the knowledge I gained is knowledge I know will be practical in the future!! Very glad I took it.
It was a very good general introduction to modern art. It was very enjoyable.
Great background in modern art history
General background on modern art and artists that partook in the movement.
I learnt a lot about modernism art and painting and a lot of art theory
Modernist art from the 1860s until ~1950s, a lot of beautiful art and captivating characters!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Professor Fiduccia's lectures are wonderful. It's evident that she pours a lot of thought into conveying a narrative (in such an elegant way, too!). I honestly did not want to miss a single lecture of hers.
It is a great class, with great topics. I got a great overview of western modernism, exactly what I hoped to get from it.
Great course! If anything, I wish there was more room for questions in the lectures.

Strengths: Passionate professor
Weaknesses: Low engagement in the class; pretty repetitive weeks.
It's really nice! I like this course so much and lecture was super engaging. I like the materials and the readings. You would know a lot about modern art history

The course is a really great survey of modernist art, perhaps sometimes at the expense of going in-depth into certain artists but that's what you get with a survey course. There's a great range of artists, including artists from the Americas that add an interesting contrast to European modernists (i may even have wanted to hear more about modernists from non western nations that was hinted at).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! If you are even remotely interested in modern art, this is the course to take.

I would highly recommend this class to another student, and was surprised that there were so few students in the class. Professor Fiduccia is great--very kind and smart, and super passionate about the topic. It is clear she puts a lot of time into formatting interesting and informative lectures. The class is a great opportunity to learn more about modernism as a movement and to visit the YUAG more.
Maybe. The content was interesting, but the workload felt excessive.
Yes
Yes! Awesome class
If you are interested in a general understanding of modern art, then yes.
Yes! you could learn a lot about history of art and modernism life
Absolutely yes! I loved this class so much it was my first art class and I'm happy I took it. I learned so much.
